trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with SumoLogic | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with SumoLogic | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use SumoLogic with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use SumoLogic with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and SumoLogic.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and SumoLogic.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A SumoLogic tenant
trans-unit.target: A SumoLogic tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to SumoLogicwill be able to single sign into the application at your SumoLogic company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to SumoLogicwill be able to single sign into the application at your SumoLogic company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for SumoLogic
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for SumoLogic

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for SumoLogic.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for SumoLogic.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type sumologic.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type sumologic.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select SumoLogic, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select SumoLogic, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SumoLogic</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SumoLogic</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to SumoLogic with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to SumoLogic with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your SumoLogictenant.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your SumoLogictenant.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the SumoLogic application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the SumoLogic application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to SumoLogic page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to SumoLogic page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the SumoLogic Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://\.SumoLogic.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the SumoLogic Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://\.SumoLogic.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure aoo URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure aoo URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at SumoLogic page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at SumoLogic page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your SumoLogic company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your SumoLogic company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Manage \> Security.
trans-unit.target: Go to Manage \> Security.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click SAML.
trans-unit.target: Click SAML.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Global security settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Global security settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Select a configuration or create a new one list, select Azure AD, and then click Configure.
trans-unit.target: From the Select a configuration or create a new one list, select Azure AD, and then click Configure.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure SAML 2.0</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure SAML 2.0</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure SAML 2.0 dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Configure SAML 2.0 dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure SAML 2.0</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure SAML 2.0</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Configuration Name textbox, type Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: In the Configuration Name textbox, type Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Select Debug Mode.
trans-unit.target: Select Debug Mode.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at SumoLogic dialogue page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at SumoLogic dialogue page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at SumoLogic dialogue page, copy the Authentication Request URL value, and then paste it into the Authn Request URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at SumoLogic dialogue page, copy the Authentication Request URL value, and then paste it into the Authn Request URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a Base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a Base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste the entire Certificate into X.509 Certificate textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste the entire Certificate into X.509 Certificate textbox.

trans-unit.source: As Email Attribute, select Use SAML subject.
trans-unit.target: As Email Attribute, select Use SAML subject.

trans-unit.source: Select SP initiated Login Configuration.
trans-unit.target: Select SP initiated Login Configuration.

trans-unit.source: In the Login Path textbox, type Azure.
trans-unit.target: In the Login Path textbox, type Azure.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at SumoLogic dialogue page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at SumoLogic dialogue page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into SumoLogic, they must be provisioned to SumoLogic.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into SumoLogic, they must be provisioned to SumoLogic.

trans-unit.source: In the case of SumoLogic, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of SumoLogic, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your SumoLogic tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your SumoLogic tenant.

trans-unit.source: Go to Manage \> Users.
trans-unit.target: Go to Manage \> Users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add.
trans-unit.target: Click Add.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the New User dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the New User dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the related information of the Azure AD account you want to provision into the First Name, Last Name and Email textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the related information of the Azure AD account you want to provision into the First Name, Last Name and Email textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Select a role.
trans-unit.target: Select a role.

trans-unit.source: As Status, select Active.
trans-unit.target: As Status, select Active.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other SumoLogic user account creation tools or APIs provided by SumoLogic to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other SumoLogic user account creation tools or APIs provided by SumoLogic to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the SumoLogic application integration page, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the SumoLogic application integration page, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
